Name: Arm Chuck Roast
Chinese Name: 牛臂肉塊 / 前腿心肉
Texture & Notes: Rich beefy flavor; firm texture that becomes tender and falls apart when slow-cooked.

Name: Arm Chuck Steak
Chinese Name: 牛臂牛排 / 前腿心牛排
Texture & Notes: Chewy if not tenderized; contains connective tissue that softens with moist heat.

Name: Blade Chuck Roast
Texture & Notes: Fatty and flavorful; excellent collagen breakdown makes it succulent.

Name: Blade Chuck Steak
Texture & Notes: Similar to the roast but thinner; can be tough without moist heat.

Name: 7-Bone Chuck Roast
Texture & Notes: Named for "7" shaped bone; very rich flavor, moist when braised.

Name: Chuck Center Roast
Texture & Notes: Balance of tender/tough muscles; juicy if not overcooked.

Name: Denver Steak
Chinese Name: 丹佛牛排 / 翼板牛排
Texture & Notes: Surprisingly tender for chuck; well-marbled and rich flavor.

Name: Chuck Eye Roast
Texture & Notes: Continuation of Ribeye muscle; tender and flavorful but fatty.

Name: Chuck Eye Steak
Texture & Notes: "The Poor Man's Ribeye"; excellent value, tender, and juicy.

Name: Country-Style Ribs
Texture & Notes: Meaty and fatty; fork-tender when cooked low and slow.

Name: Cross Rib Chuck Roast
Chinese Name: 肩胛底板肉 / 交叉肋肉
Texture & Notes: Firmer/leaner than other chuck roasts; needs liquid to stay moist.

Name: Shoulder Roast
Texture & Notes: Lean and tough; becomes shreddable with long braising.

Name: Shoulder Steak*
Texture & Notes: Fibrous and tough; essential to marinate before high heat.

Name: Ranch Steak*
Chinese Name: 牧場牛排 / 肩心牛排
Texture & Notes: Lean with mild flavor; can be chewy if cooked past medium.

Name: Flat Iron Steak
Chinese Name: 平鐵牛排 / 翼板牛排
Texture & Notes: Extremely tender (2nd to filet); well-marbled and beefy.

Name: Top Blade Steak*
Texture & Notes: Flavorful but has a tough line of gristle down the center.

Name: Shoulder Petite Tender
Texture & Notes: "Teres Major"; resembles tenderloin in texture but has more flavor.

Name: Shoulder Petite Tender Medallions
Chinese Name: 嫩肩里肌片 / 嫩肩菲力
Texture & Notes: Tender rounds perfect for quick searing; lean and elegant.

Name: Short Ribs, Bone-In
Texture & Notes: Very rich, high fat; melts into a buttery texture when braised.

Name: Prime Rib Roast
Chinese Name: 頂級肋眼視肉 / 燒烤肋眼
Texture & Notes: The gold standard; exceptionally tender, juicy, and marbled.

Name: Ribeye Steak, Bone-In
Texture & Notes: Rich, buttery fat rendering; bone adds flavor/insulation.

Name: Back Ribs
Texture & Notes: Meat between rib bones; chewy but flavorful finger food.

Name: Ribeye Roast, Boneless
Texture & Notes: Same as Prime Rib w/o bones; easier to carve, very tender.

Name: Ribeye Steak, Boneless
Texture & Notes: Highly marbled with distinct fat "kernel"; robust beef flavor.

Name: Ribeye Cap Steak
Texture & Notes: "The Butcher's Butter"; arguably the most delicious cut on the cow.

Name: Ribeye Petite Roast
Texture & Notes: A smaller portion of the ribeye; quick cooking and tender.

Name: Ribeye Filet
Texture & Notes: Center eye of ribeye; combines filet tenderness with ribeye flavor.

Name: Porterhouse Steak
Texture & Notes: Two steaks in one (Strip + large Tenderloin).

Name: T-Bone Steak
Texture & Notes: Similar to Porterhouse but with smaller tenderloin section.

Name: Strip Steak, Bone-In
Texture & Notes: Firm bite, moderate marbling, deep beefy flavor.

Name: Strip Steak, Boneless
Texture & Notes: Tighter texture than ribeye but flavorful; lean but tender.

Name: Strip Petite Roast
Texture & Notes: A small roast cut from the strip loin; easy to carve.

Name: Strip Filet
Texture & Notes: Thick cut from center of strip; uniform shape cooks evenly.

Name: Tenderloin Roast
Texture & Notes: Most tender roast available; lean, mild flavor, buttery texture.

Name: Tenderloin Steak
Texture & Notes: Fork-tender, melt-in-your-mouth; very lean and mild.

Name: Top Sirloin Steak
Chinese Name: 上後腰脊牛排 / 頂級沙朗
Texture & Notes: Versatile/affordable; firm texture with good beef flavor.

Name: Top Sirloin Petite Roast
Texture & Notes: Lean and economical; cook medium-rare to avoid dryness.

Name: Top Sirloin Filet
Texture & Notes: Thick cut like filet mignon but firmer and more flavorful.

Name: Coulotte Roast
Chinese Name: 上後腰脊蓋肉 / 臀肉蓋
Texture & Notes: Signature fat cap bastes meat; extremely flavorful and juicy.

Name: Coulotte Steak
Texture & Notes: Cut from the cap; tender and rich if fat cap is rendered.

Name: Tri-Tip Roast
Texture & Notes: Triangle shape; lean but flavorful; grain changes direction.

Name: Tri-Tip Steak
Texture & Notes: Individual steaks from roast; distinctive grain and chew.

Name: Petite Sirloin Steak
Texture & Notes: Small, lean, quick-cooking; tough if overcooked.

Name: Sirloin Bavette Steak
Chinese Name: 後腰脊角尖牛排 / 貝腹肉
Texture & Notes: Loose grain structure holds marinades; chewy but savory.

Name: Top Round Steak*
Texture & Notes: Lean and tough; best marinated or tenderized (cubed).

Name: Top Round Roast
Texture & Notes: The "Sunday Roast"; lean, easy to slice; can be dry.

Name: Bottom Round Roast
Texture & Notes: Tougher than top round; tighter grain; needs moisture.

Name: Bottom Round Steak*
Texture & Notes: Very lean/firm; requires mechanical tenderizing or slow heat.

Name: Bottom Round Rump Roast
Texture & Notes: Ideally braised; flavorful but tough connective tissue.

Name: Eye of Round Roast
Chinese Name: 鯉魚管肉 / 後腿眼肉
Texture & Notes: Cylindrical; very lean/tough; looks tender but is not.

Name: Eye of Round Steak*
Chinese Name: 鯉魚管牛排 / 後腿眼牛排
Texture & Notes: Sold thin; very lean; easy to overcook into "shoe leather."

Name: Kabobs*
Texture & Notes: Usually sirloin/round chunks; best marinated.

Name: Stew Meat
Texture & Notes: Misc. tough trimmings; high collagen thickens stews.

Name: Strips*
Texture & Notes: Pre-cut strips; cooks very fast.

Name: Cubed Steak
Chinese Name: 機器嫩化牛排 / 什錦牛排
Texture & Notes: Mechanically tenderized; distinct texture.

Name: Ground Beef
Texture & Notes: Texture depends on fat content (80/20 juicy, 90/10 crumbly).

Name: Shank Cross-Cut
Chinese Name: 帶骨牛腱 / 牛腱心切片
Texture & Notes: Contains marrow bone; tough/gelatinous; incredible broth.

Name: Tenderloin Tips
Chinese Name: 菲力邊角肉 / 骰子菲力
Texture & Notes: Trimmings from tenderloin; just as tender as filet.

Name: Brisket Flat
Texture & Notes: Leaner half of brisket; firm slice; dense grain.

Name: Brisket Point
Texture & Notes: Fatty half of brisket; luscious, moist, intense flavor.

Name: Inside Skirt*
Texture & Notes: Long flat cut; open grain; marinade sponge; chewy but tasty.

Name: Flank Steak*
Chinese Name: 腹脅肉牛排 / 扇子肉
Texture & Notes: Flat oval cut; distinct grain; lean/chewy; slice against grain!

Name: Short Ribs, Bone-In (lean)
Texture & Notes: Rich, fatty, melting texture.
